parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From diakonos; to be an attendant, i.e. Wait upon (figuratively) teacher; technically, to act as a Christian deacon.
Timothy, a Christian of Lystra, helper of Paul. From time and theos; dear to God; Timotheus, a Christian.
Erastus, steward of Corinth, a Christian. From erao; beloved; Erastus, a Christian.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
(Hebrew), Macedonia, a Roman province north of Achaia (Greece). From Makedon; Macedonia, a region of Greece.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From epi and echo; to hold upon, i.e. to retain; to detain; to pay attention to.
A space of time or interval; by extension, an individual opportunity; by implication, delay.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Asia, i.e. Asia Minor, or only its western shore.
